meanings.definition: A type of flatbread or cake made from oatmeal or barley meal
meanings.sent1: The bannock smelled delicious as it baked in the oven.
meanings.sent2: I enjoyed a warm bannock with my soup for lunch.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole a bannock from the picnic basket.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a freshly baked bannock.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's secret recipe made the bannock taste like a piece of heaven.

meanings.sent1: She will bannock the bread for the family dinner.
meanings.sent2: In the morning, I always bannock fresh pastries for the cafe.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to bannock a special dessert for the occasion.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of bannocking bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: He bannocked the cookies with care, ensuring they were golden brown.

meanings.sent1: The bannock cake was the highlight of the party.
meanings.sent2: She sliced a piece of the bannock loaf for a snack.
meanings.sent3: The giant bannock loaf towered over the tiny cupcakes.
meanings.sent4: The bannock cake was as fluffy as a cloud.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the bannock loaf filled the room with warmth.
